alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 7:27PM MDT until July 08 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, Mora and San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.36 inches of rain have fallen over Dog Creek and Arroyo Needam, with up to 0.65 of an inch on Wolf Creek. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding through Dog Creek, Arroyo Needam, Wolf Creek, and the Mora River downstream to the confluence with the Canadian River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valmora and Shoemaker. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 369 and 382. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings.
